note.p: Engineer, musician, and authority on whist. Professor of engineering, Elphinstone College, Bombay, 1844–7. Worked on various engineering projects in Europe and Algeria. Professor of engineering, University College, London, 1859–67. Served on a number of committees and commissions of enquiry. Published widely, including in the popular press. Played the organ, organised concerts, and published on music; took a music doctorate at Oxford in 1867. Played and published on whist. FRS 1861.
